ygData.messageBody:
I fully admit, and am glad for it, that SKs will indeed be a class to
be reckoned with.

However i must stick with my previous comments on HT. Sure if a few SKs
got together and HT'd a Griffon to death quick and easy, they would get
good exp. But that would be it for another hour and a half. If thats
what they want to do with their HT instead of keeping it for an
emergency where HT is the only thing that'll save them, thats up to the
individuals involved. Its not like they'll be able to walk around and
HT everything to death right after that.

And as for LoH getting interrupted, i have heard this about HT,
although its never happened to me.
I would like to hear from any SK on this.
If this is true, then we're back to square one. LoH 1000 healing, HT
500dmg, but resisted by the creatures you would actually use it
against.

And we all know that a toning down of LoH just isn't going to happen.
We could campaign the rest of our lives and it'll never even be
considered.
So what's left?
Tweak HT.
HT is only powerful WHEN it works. Which seems to be less and less as
we gain higher levels and fight bigger creatures.

And i still feel that it should work every time.

But aside from our differences of opinion, i would like to hear what
you think would be a good way to get the Dev team's attention with our
various concerns.

Talking about these topics on message boards and mailing lists is OK,
but this wont accomplish anything as far as the game is concerned.
Lets do that pro-active thing i hear so much about.

Thanks for responding,

Bathory
Cazic-Thule

--- Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...> wrote:
> From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
>
> i completely agree, i would personally like to sit
> down with the game
> balance programmers and get THEIR explainations of
> how paladins and SK are
> evenly matched. however, i think i can understand a
> few possible reasons why
> things are as they are:
>
> ok, so at lvl 9 a paladin could probably beat up a
> lvl 9 sk good, on account
> of the paladin has 3 times normal hp (due to all the
> healing), whereas we
> get a spell that bites him for 5 damage and suck
> away some of his str. but
> eventually i think we accelerate in power faster
> than paladins.. by the time
> we get to lvl 50 in our best equipment, we would be
> fully capable of beating
> the snot out of a lvl 50 paladin in his best
> equipment. (also, we dont have
> to kill the lava dragon for a darkreaver ;)) upon
> checking back to the guild
> periodically i have seen a great many necro spells
> being imped for SK use at
> high level, including some of the powerful DOT
> spells, spirit armor, and
> expulse undead.
>
> also, while i admit that HT vs lay on hands isnt
> very fair, remember that HT
> IS rather powerful. most melee combat classes cant
> boast the ability to
> knock off a third or a half of their target's life
> with a single attack and
> still be able to go ahead and wail away with nasty
> implements of pointy
> death. my suggestion is not to boost HT, but to TONE
> DOWN lay on hands. the
> ability to heal that much is just not reasonable;
> altho i have heard of
> people having lay on hands interrupted, while it is
> not possible to
> interrupt HT that i have seen, it being
> instantaneous. can anyone confirm
> the possibility of lay on hands to be interrupted?
>
> there is a very good reason why HT can be resisted:
> imagine about 20 lvl 10
> sk all charge a griffin and simultaneously lay a
> harm touch on it, causing
> it to die instantly. now somebody is going to get a
> crapload of xp out of
> that, and it'd be a hideously unfair trick for us.
> even more lame than the
> little bard accelerando-run in circles-bellow thing!
> i admit i become quite
> annoyed seeing HT resisted or soaked altogether, but
> i try very hard not to
> fight things that are guaranteed to resist it when
> it can be helped anyway :)
>
> now, if only they will figure out why we and
> paladins cant hit worth a damn,
> i think both classes are fully toe to toe with most
> other classes for the
> better part of the game. i still think it'd be a bad
> idea to duel a lvl 50
> wizard with an SK, but the again, who COULD? :)
>
> Beld Demonblade <- just named! :D
> Fennin Ro
